Gryphon

Gryphons are large, intelligent animals with the hind-quarters of a lion, the front part of a great eagle, and a pair of massive, feathered wings.

Stats

Pathfinder

Vanilla

http://www.d20pfsrd.com/bestiary/monster-listings/magical-beasts/griffon

Mighty

As Vanilla but gains the following Special Abilities:

Wingbeat

As a full round action, a mighty gryphon may beat its enormous wings once to create a blast of air as the Gust of Wind spell, in a line as wide as the gryphon, and may also move up to half its fly speed in any direction other than that of the air blast. The gryphon must have a fly speed of at least 20ft to use this ability, and must move at least 10ft.

Stormy

As Vanilla but gains the following Special Abilities:

Static Blast

Every 2d4 rounds the gryphon may muster the the power of storms to channel electricity and winds as the spell Discordant Blast. This ability is activated as a standard action, and must be released as another standard action the next round, or forfeit. Between these actions gryphon can move at only half speed, has the benefits of the Defensive Shock spell (CL 1), and the air within ten feet of it, thick with electricity, is considered difficult terrain.

Arcane

As Vanilla but gains two level 1 spontaneous spell slots, and one level 2 spontaneous spell slot per day, with knowledge of up to three spells from the Wizard/Sorcerer spell list. For example:

  • Glitterdust
  • Arcane Disruption
  • Burst of Radiance
  • Fire Breath
  • Command Undead

Ecology
